commit_message:
Make directory structure match Angular modules

This patch changes the directory structure of the common Angular
components (horizon/static/angular/) to better match the structure
of the modules themselves.

For example, now the module hz.widget.wizard is defined by
/horizon/static/angular/widget/wizard/wizard.js (instead of
/horizon/static/angular/wizard/wizard.js). The problem was that
files from multiple modules lived in /horizon/static/angular
making it unclear where to find source for a particular module.

This patch also separates hz.widget and hz.framework (which were
two separate modules) into different directories.

This new structure tries to make it more clear where .js files
for existing modules, or new module directories will live.

These changes clear the way for new modules that contain services
such as a planned hz.framework.utilities (not added in this patch).

Finally, the login and MagicSearch code which were not part of
framework or widget modules are moved to the top level
(static/angular/).

Change-Id: I6734fdac8065b17b05f09aa7667a60e7bbcefacc

subject: Two changes about count calculation in ScalingPolicy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 03:30:31.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/policies/scaling_policy.py'], 'message': "Two changes about count calculation in ScalingPolicy

1. We don't allow the count to be negative when doing scalingout
operatioin and also don't allow positive count result when doing
scalingin operation.
2. Absolute value of count will be used to fill in both creation
and deletion fields of policy data.

Change-Id: Id6e12cacba52f3a3c673df50607c614ea025e3fa
"}]
commit_message:
Two changes about count calculation in ScalingPolicy

1. We don't allow the count to be negative when doing scalingout
operatioin and also don't allow positive count result when doing
scalingin operation.
2. Absolute value of count will be used to fill in both creation
and deletion fields of policy data.

Change-Id: Id6e12cacba52f3a3c673df50607c614ea025e3fa

Change-Id: I80f8d537c36b6cd598cdcf87f77df418db8ed035
'}]
commit_message:
Kolla runs process on rabbit, not rabbitmq

The kolla script runs its process on rabbit, not rabbitmq.  This
results in the rabbitmq compose scirpt not being executed.

Change-Id: I80f8d537c36b6cd598cdcf87f77df418db8ed035

subject: Do not bindmount nova-compute directories
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 20:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['compose/nova-compute.yml'], 'message': 'Do not bindmount nova-compute directories

Nova uses a data container.  Data containers are expected to
use the VOLUME keyword and then use volumes_from to access
those volumes.  Throwing in a bindmount to the host filesystem
results in unpredicble behavior, usually in the form of files
being stored on the host filesystem that should be persisted
in the compute data volume.

Change-Id: I60a7873995c9397368ed4df61d5a6d4e8250f3c2
'}]
commit_message:
Do not bindmount nova-compute directories

Nova uses a data container.  Data containers are expected to
use the VOLUME keyword and then use volumes_from to access
those volumes.  Throwing in a bindmount to the host filesystem
results in unpredicble behavior, usually in the form of files
being stored on the host filesystem that should be persisted
in the compute data volume.

Change-Id: I60a7873995c9397368ed4df61d5a6d4e8250f3c2

Add license information

* LICENSE file placed to every package
* License information is shown during application creation
* License added to every file

Change-Id: If54c6c864f7fa7c52512cbd1dfe8c8cae83739c8
Closes-Bug: #1446121

commit_message:
Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY default to REBUILD

If a server network using port id, update image property will fail
with error 'port is still in use'. Set IMAGE_UPDATE_POLICY to
REBUILD will preserve the port information when update the image.

Closes-Bug: #1439708
Change-Id: I023ee076682bd5febb960dc8754d61986fd9bedf

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-20 07:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kwargs['migration'] KeyError in @errors_out_migration decorator

@errors_out_migration decorator is used in the compute manager on
resize_instance and finish_resize methods of ComputeManager class.
It is decorated via @utils.expects_func_args('migration') to check
'migration' is a parameter to the decorator method, however, that
only ensures there is a migration argument, not that it's in args or
kwargs (either is fine for what expects_func_args checks).
The errors_out_migration decorator can get a KeyError when checking
kwargs['migration'] and fails to set the migration status to 'error'.

This fixes the KeyError in the decorator by normalizing the args/kwargs
list into a single dict that we can pull the migration from.

Change-Id: I774ac9b749b21085f4fbcafa4965a78d68eec9c7
Closes-Bug: 1444300

revisions:

this patch cleans those column declaration which is having
default value for the nullable field as it is not required
explicitly

Change-Id: I22b0d62238298fa49da09c53019408bc2049b893
Closes-bug: #1439959
"}]
commit_message:
Cleans nullable=True in db model column declaration

By default sqlalchemy considers the Column's nullable=True and
this patch cleans those column declaration which is having
default value for the nullable field as it is not required
explicitly

Change-Id: I22b0d62238298fa49da09c53019408bc2049b893
Closes-bug: #1439959

subject: Add project-specific control over stable/kilo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-21 21:24:09.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/barbican.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/manila.config'], 'message': 'Add project-specific control over stable/kilo

Some repos participating in the integrated release process for the
first time lacked existing project-specific permissions to control
proposed patches on their stable/kilo branches. Add these for
consistency with other repos.

Change-Id: I151dc3cd13f4df91fdbc1d68405a80e798ad9506
'}]
commit_message:
Add project-specific control over stable/kilo

Some repos participating in the integrated release process for the
first time lacked existing project-specific permissions to control
proposed patches on their stable/kilo branches. Add these for
consistency with other repos.

Change-Id: I151dc3cd13f4df91fdbc1d68405a80e798ad9506

commit_message:
Allow ACL sections to use .*-release group names

These are what the old .*-ptl groups were renamed to last year, for
better clarity.

Change-Id: I4764f6ab7c74adfbdcaba0a12d81a062beb9dc40

The settings dashboard currently did not have a cancel_url
which created a 404 message to the user when selecting the

commit_message:
Added cancel_url to settings dashboard

The settings dashboard currently did not have a cancel_url
which created a 404 message to the user when selecting the
cancel button instead of the submit button. This fix brings
the user back to the existing page and clears out any values
entered.

Future updates can redirect the user to a different page
instead of the current page they are on, but this avoids
giving the user a 404 page.

Change-Id: I42888b6323928c94713117dac20e597e74bdfb0c
Closes-Bug: #1434548

commit_message:
Add support to incremental backups in cinder

Added a new option to "cinder backup-create" to support incremental backups.
Specify --incremental to create an incremental backup. By default, it will
be a full backup.

Co-Authored-By: Xing Yang <xing.yang@emc.com>
Implements: blueprint incremental-backup
Change-Id: Id11ecd2982ea838181b4adaa5a742fc65f864acb
